analysis: The documents primarily concern the withdrawal and revocation of public lands from settlement, location, sale, entry, and appropriation, pending or following resurveys. These actions are authorized by the act of June 25, 1910, and its amendment of August 24, 1912. The documents specify townships and ranges in states like Colorado, New Mexico, Wyoming and Nevada, referencing principal meridians for land description. Some orders revoke previous executive orders related to land withdrawal, while others newly withdraw lands. The purpose is to facilitate accurate land management through resurveys.
title: Land Resurvey and Management
